verses.verse: And Ahab<WH256> told<WH5046> Jezebel<WH348> all that Elijah<WH452> had done<WH6213>, and withal how he had slain<WH2026> all the prophets<WH5030> with the sword<WH2719>.

But he himself went<WH1980> a day<WH3117>'s journey<WH1870> into the wilderness<WH4057>, and came<WH935> and sat down<WH3427> under a<WH259> juniper-tree<WH7574>: and he requested<WH7592> for himself<WH5315> that he might die<WH4191>, and said<WH559>, It is enough<WH7227>; now<WH3068>, O Jehovah, take away<WH3947> my life<WH5315>; for I am not better<WH2896> than my fathers<WH1>.

And he looked<WH5027>, and<WH4763>, behold, there was at his head a cake<WH5692> baken on the coals<WH7529>, and a cruse<WH6835> of water<WH4325>. And he did eat<WH398> and drink<WH8354>, and laid him down<WH7901> again<WH7725>.

And he arose<WH6965>, and did eat<WH398> and drink<WH8354>, and went<WH3212> in the strength<WH3581> of that food<WH396> forty<WH705> days<WH3117> and forty<WH705> nights<WH3915> unto Horeb<WH2722> the mount<WH2022> of God<WH430>.

And he came<WH935> thither unto a cave<WH4631>, and lodged<WH3885> there<WH1697>; and, behold, the word of Jehovah<WH3068> came to him<WH559>, and he said unto him<WH452>, What doest thou here, Elijah?

And he said<WH559>, I have been very<WH7065> jealous<WH7065> for Jehovah<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of hosts<WH6635>; for the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> have forsaken<WH5800> thy covenant<WH1285>, thrown down<WH2040> thine altars<WH4196>, and slain<WH2026> thy prophets<WH5030> with the sword<WH2719>: and I<WH3498>, even I only, am left; and they seek<WH1245> my life<WH5315>, to take it away<WH3947>.

And he said<WH559>, Go forth<WH3318>, and stand<WH5975> upon the mount<WH2022> before<WH6440> Jehovah<WH3068>. And<WH3068>, behold, Jehovah passed by<WH5674>, and a great<WH1419> and strong<WH2389> wind<WH7307> rent<WH6561> the mountains<WH2022>, and brake in pieces<WH7665> the rocks<WH5553> before<WH6440> Jehovah<WH3068>; but Jehovah<WH3068> was not in the wind<WH7307>: and after<WH310> the wind<WH7307> an earthquake<WH7494>; but Jehovah<WH3068> was not in the earthquake<WH7494>:

And he said<WH559>, I have been very<WH7065> jealous<WH7065> for Jehovah<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of hosts<WH6635>; for the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> have forsaken<WH5800> thy covenant<WH1285>, thrown down<WH2040> thine altars<WH4196>, and slain<WH2026> thy prophets<WH5030> with the sword<WH2719>; and I<WH3498>, even I only, am left; and they seek<WH1245> my life<WH5315>, to take it away<WH3947>.

And Jehovah<WH3068> said<WH559> unto him<WH3212>, Go, return<WH7725> on thy way<WH1870> to the wilderness<WH4057> of Damascus<WH1834>: and when thou comest<WH935>, thou shalt anoint<WH4886> Hazael<WH2371> to be king<WH4428> over Syria<WH758>;

Yet will I leave<WH7604> me seven<WH7651> thousand<WH505> in Israel<WH3478>, all the knees<WH1290> which have not bowed<WH3766> unto Baal<WH1168>, and every mouth<WH6310> which hath not kissed him<WH5401>.

And he left<WH5800> the oxen<WH1241>, and ran<WH7323> after<WH310> Elijah<WH452>, and said<WH559>, Let me<WH5401>, I pray thee, kiss my father<WH1> and my mother<WH517>, and then I will follow<WH3212> thee<WH559>. And he said unto him<WH3212>, Go back again<WH7725>; for what have I done to thee<WH6213>?
